intro: Vincetoxicum longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved ironweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct, slightly aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. Vincetoxicum longifolium is valued for its ornamental value and its ability to support local pollinators.
